sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Below is a list of packages you need to download for building a basic Linux system. The listed version numbers correspond to versions of the software that are known to work, and this book is based upon them. You can try out newer versions, of course, but if you experience problems with those versions, use the indicated version instead. Often there is a reason for not using the latest version.

All the URLs, when possible, refer to the project's page at Freshmeat.net. The Freshmeat pages will give you easy access to the official download sites as well as project websites, mailinglists, FAQs, Changelogs and more.

sect1.title: Needed patches
sect1.para: Besides all those packages, you'll also need several patches. These correct tiny mistakes in the packages that should be fixed by the maintainer, or just make some small modifications to bend things our way. You'll need the following:

sect1.para: In addition, there are a number of optional patches that have been created by the LFS community. Most of these solve slight problems, or enable some functionality that's not enabled by default. Please feel free to examine the patches database, located at , and choose any additional patches you might wish to use.
